reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used to stay at the Hilton Newcastle Gateshead regularly but hadn't been for a while. I stayed there at the end of July and was very disappointed with the service. It started with a ten minute queue to check in. Four desks, only one manned. Several staff walked past and must have seen the queue, which stretched across reception almost to the front door, but nobody thought to open a second desk.
reviews.title: Service has really declined since my last visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was OK, although it didn't have much of a view.
reviews.title: Overnight stay with dinner

reviews.text: Service was also poor at breakfast the following morning. The restaurant was only about half full, but after 20 minutes (and half way through breakfast) I had to ask for tea and coffee. When they arrived they were plonked on the table without a smile or a word, and then I had to steal two cups from an adjacent table. And I'm not sure what the "scrambled egg" was made from, but I couldn't detect any taste of eggs.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, staff are amazing, especially in the executive lounge.

reviews.text: For the entire duration of my stay I never saw a member of staff smile. I don't know what's happened to this hotel; it used to be a pleasure to stay there but after this experience I won't be returning.
reviews.title: Executive lounge

reviews.text: This Hotel was very good and all the staff were excellent and would have no hesitation in recommending it to others. The position of the Hotel in Newcastle is excellent with great views of the city. You can walk to all the city sites straight out of the hotel.
reviews.title: Very friendly.

reviews.text: Arrived at Hilton Bottlebank and was impressed with the lobby. A short taxi ride from the airport, it actually in Gateshead. My room faced the river, nice view. The AC was a tad hard to fiddle with. Great bathroom.
reviews.title: Nice location, nice room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar/lounge area is fine for a drink. Had an excellent lunch (salmon salad) one day. Breakfast is a bit of a jumble; eggs cooked ahead and left out. Perhaps they offer an omlette cooked to order?
reviews.title: If it's good enough for Raul Malo ... :-)

reviews.text: All in all it was a good stay, though I left a sweater in the lounge and next day one server said he'd seen it, but then it disappeared.
reviews.title: Fantastic view

reviews.text: Martin the concierge is top notch.
reviews.title: Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be aware it's very hard to call in to the hotel to leave a message-Friends could not maneuver the phones and tried twice. You won't get your messages!
reviews.title: History on the doorstep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very new and modern and beautifully appointed, but parking was expensive and internet was only available for a very large fee, which in this day and age, should be a 'freebie' more and more hotels include.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, could have included either parking or internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to walk over the bridge (one of 3) into Newcastle and drive to Alnwick Castle for a daytrip from here.
reviews.title: loved Newcastle and Gateshead but the service at the hilton hotel made our holiday special!!

reviews.text: Glad we got it on one of their 40%off weekends.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the perfect location for a lively city!

reviews.text: Arrived early for check in but there was no problem we were in our beautiful room in no time overlooking the river and wonderful bridges!- Location was perfect quiet area at night but a short walk to the buzz of Newcastle centre!
reviews.title: Better than the Mal Maison but on the wrong side of the river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were spacious and spotless , air conditioning effective, all our needs were catered for including the leisure complex and spa
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Hotel But Staff Unwilling to Chastise Unruly Guests!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my wife stayed at the Hilton for our wedding anniversary in one of the two suites on the 5th floor of the hotel in early August. We have stayed at the hotel on several occasions and have always had an excellent stay, the staff are very friendly and the facilities are excellent. I would always recommend paying the extra for an executive level room on the 5th floor, with access to the lounge, which has excellent views of Newcastle and drinks and snacks through out the day (complimentary drinks are available on an evening from 6pm - 10 pm (Sunday to Thursday and 8pm on a Fri / Sat).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a lovely evening in the lounge watching the world go buy and helped ourselves to quite a few glasses of wine, as well as a few other beverages!!)
reviews.title: Nice hotel - Overlooking the River Tyne

reviews.text: The hotel room was very spacious with a separate lounge / dinning room and toilet adjoining a large bedroom with a huge bathroom. The lounge has a balcony which is nice to sit out on when the weather permits, and inside there is a comfy sofa and large flat screen TV.
reviews.title: Fabulous Views, Dissapointing Rooms.

reviews.text: I enjoyed an excellent swim in the pleasant pool the next morning and the breakfast was also first class.
reviews.title: Lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Newcastle / Gateshead as it is such an easy walk from the Quayside / Sage / Millennium bridge and the shopping areas. If you are looking for a romantic night away go for a Sunday night, the hotel and lounge are quite and the service is excellent.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.text: I went to the Hilton on Saturday for Afternoon Tea and a spa session with my girlfriends on Saturday.
reviews.title: Nice views, terrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly Afternoon Tea - Great selection, I have a gluten allergy and was over the moon to find Gluten Free Afternoon Tea on the menu, however the service was terrible. The waitress got our order wrong so we had to pay twice. Then it took 45mins for the food to arrive.
reviews.title: A ROOM WITH A VIEW

reviews.text: Spa - We contacted the Spa before our session, on the phone we were told that they were glad we had rang because they had doubled booked us and we needed to move. This session was for a birthday present so firstly frustrated that we had to move and more concerning was the fact that they hadn't rang to tell us. On entry to the spa the reception desk was unmanned, 15 mins later the staff appeared after all going on a break together. We ordered robes which then took 30 mins to appear. The straw that broke the camels back was that they had moved the time of the treatments again and not bothered to inform us. Another wasted trip.
reviews.title: Another excellent experience on points from my hhonours gold status - first class benefits

reviews.text: Some urgent retraining in Customer Service required across the hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous view from room

reviews.text: The view from our room over the river Tyne and the city of Newcastle was truly awesome.
reviews.title: Spa day

reviews.text: I stayed six nights in this hotel; my primary reason for having selected it was its very convenient nearness to our congress venue, the fabulous Sage. Gateshead town centre with a huge Tesco is just five minutes walk. Check-in was smooth, the first impressions, however, a little disappointing: badly stained carpet on the first floor corridor, birds’ droppings on the window, chocolate wrapping under the bed (which I didn’t remove to see if and when they would notice – in six days they didn’t). The room was a good size, river view, bathroom OK with a tub and a shower. The jet in the shower was too weak for my liking. The A/C in the room was functioning, but it had a very weird controller, and the instructions didn’t help much, I had to ask for advice. I found it absurd that they charge for the Wifi in the room. However when I needed some help with a document from the internet the concierge was most helpful- I appreciated it! Breakfast was nice, even the continental breakfast had fruit juice, cheese, some cold cuts and excellent espresso coffee included. In the evening good salmon and prawn sandwiches and nice cold draft lager in the bar. If you have programs in the Sage the Hilton is a good choice.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: This hotel continues to impress time after time. I have been returning to this hotel on an almost monthly basis since it first opened and have enjoyed a warm welcome and customer service that is second to none. Whether it is a friendly welcome at reception, casual chat with the restaurant staff or a cheery exchange with the housekeeping team everyone aims to please and I always look forward to my next visit. Over the last three years I have been accompanied by my young son and mother and again the staff have been exceptional in making them feel welcome. Special mention must go to Jeanette who's personable, professional and 'can do' attitude is a treat for those fortunate enough to have use of the Executive Lounge.
reviews.title: Return Guest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant has always been of a good standard with something for everyone and the bar and room service menus also offer a good variety of dishes.
reviews.title: Sunday Night Stay

reviews.text: The hotel location is only a short walk from The Sage and a five minute taxi ride from the many shops, restaurants and nightlife.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my partner stayed in July for an overnight on a Sunday. Check in was fast an efficient and the lobby is large and spacious with the most beautiful scent of fresh Lillies.
reviews.title: Five night stay
Best hotel I've stayed at in the UK!
reviews.text: Breakfast was fabulous (absolutely everything you could think of inc veggie sausages and whisky to go with porridge?!) Rooms were well sized and we had a great view of river. Great decor in room and all through hotel. Great swim/sauna amenties. Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries were a nice touch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at The Hilton in Gateshead on several occasions and always enjoyed the experience.
reviews.title: Truly wonderful accommodation

reviews.text: We have stayed in many 4-5 star hotels and find that the breakfast in this Hilton hotel is one of the best we have tasted.
reviews.title: Worst hotel accommodation EVER

reviews.text: The spa and the swimming pool is very nice
reviews.title: Great service bar area could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious, well decorated and spotless. The hotel is well located especially for the Quayside with a 15minute walk uphill into Newcastle centre
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with 5 star service in a excellent location

reviews.text: Metro Radio calls the north east 'The Greatest Place on Earth', so with excellent views of the Tyne Bridge this Hilton must have the greatest view on Earth.
reviews.title: The Greatest View on Earth
Great Hotel, but Reception could be happier
reviews.text: I'd strongly recommend booking a room with a river view so you can enjoy excellent views of the bridge. The hotel is within walking distance from Gateshead Metro station although with luggage I'd advise getting a taxi, the hotel is only a few minutes drive away from Newcastle Central.
All the staff I've encountered (check-in, exec lounge and bar) have been friendly and professional, I didn't encounter any issues in this regard.
reviews.title: The Oceans Spa Rooms

reviews.text: The main issue when travelling with luggage is the steep hills leading down to both Gateshead and Newcastle Quaysides, that's why I recommend a taxi, but when you don't have luggage it's an easy walk into Newcastle. I recommend if you're after shopping to walk along the Tyne Bridge, if you're after nightlife then use the lower bridges (Swing Bridge and Millennium Bridge) to reach the Quayside where most of the bars are.
reviews.title: Great Benchmark

reviews.text: I grew up in the north east and I remember this hotel being built. I thought it was odd at the time that they'd build the hotel on the Gateshead side of the river. Since then Gateshead has got a lot of its own to offer, including the Baltic (their restaurant, SIX, also has excellent river views) and Sage centres. If you want to visit the MetroCentre then just walk up the hill to Gateshead transport interchange and get the X66 bus, despite the name you can't get the Metro to the MetroCentre (the north east seems to love the word 'Metro' we have Metro Radio too).
reviews.title: A pleasant stay
